My Projects

Check out some of my projects...

Android Development - Quizlet App

The Quizlet Application.  One of my first Android Projects.  A simple yet effective app.

Objective:

Write a two screen Android application in portrait mode that allows a user to prepare for ‘matching-style’ quizzes. When the program is running, it will display one term and four possible definitions; one of which is the correct one. The user will then select which definition they think matches the term displayed. The program will indicate if the user has made a correct or incorrect selection by displaying a toast message.

Brief Description:

I Enjoyed this assignment. It through me into the world of Android - which was great for an introduction. The app uses a HashMap to pair keys and values (answers and questions) for answer validation read in from a file. This was the first time I've had to implement a HashMap. So not only was it an introduction to Android Development, I also learned new Java technologies too.

The challenge part of this assignment I found to be populating the buttons with answers. First the correct answer had to be inserted into a random button. Then the others had to be populated with false answers, without over-writing the correct answer. At the end of it all I wound up with a single method that compared text values of the buttons against the HashMap pairs, and if the buttons had been populated in the first place.

You can find the code on Git Hub using the link above.

Web Devlopment - Electronic Portfolio

My Web Poprtfolio.  A display of Projects and Skills.

Objective:

Create and Electronic Portfolio that showcases your skills and work. The project will be comprised of three phases, Research, Design and Implementation.

  • Research: Look at other portfolios/modern web designs to get inspiration.
  • Design: Create Mockups of your web page designs in Adobe Photoshop for both desktop and mobile devices. Plan your layout to be completely responsive.
  • Implementation: Code your mockups using an editor of your choice.

Brief Description:

My first attempt at a high-quality website using SASS and JavaScript. I used a mix of techniques for the functionality of each webpage. Flex, grid and standard display settings. This was also the first time I’ve attempted to implemented CSS animations and overlay effects.

This project took me though from the basics of how to install JS Node to using JS to manipulate class tags and element IDs.  I found the animations a fun and interesting experience. I was expecting them to de difficult, but CSS has surprised me again. The most challenging part of the assignment was the responsive layout – in particular rearranging grid items. However, with a little research and some trial and error the DIVs now switch positions in a mobile layout.

You can find the code on Git Hub using the link above.
